title: doc: go1.7.html uses inconsistent spelling of cancelation
body:
`doc/go1.7.html` says:

> Go 1.7 moves the `golang.org/x/net/context` package into the standard library as `context`. This allows the use of contexts for **cancellation**, timeouts, and passing request-scoped data in other standard library packages â€¦

Every occurrence of this word in `context`, `net/dial`, and `net/http` documentation uses the "cancelation" spelling instead.

It looks like Solaris signal definitions are the only other user-facing instance of the "cancellation" spelling in the `go` repo, and `src/runtime/signal_solaris.go` includes a comment explaining the discrepancy:

    /* 36 */ {_SigSetStack + _SigUnblock, "SIGCANCEL: reserved signal for thread cancellation"}, // Oracle's spelling of cancelation.

`doc/go1.7.html` should read "cancelation" for consistency.
